info.headline: Heat Advisory issued June 13 at 2:51PM CDT until June 13 at 7:00PM CDT by NWS Corpus Christi
info.description: ...HEAT ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM CDT THIS EVENING... ...HEAT ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 1 PM TO 7 PM CDT WEDNESDAY... ...EXCESSIVE HEAT WATCH IN EFFECT FROM THURSDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH THURSDAY EVENING... * WHAT...For the Heat Advisories, heat index values up to 114 degree expected. For the Excessive Heat Watch, dangerously hot conditions with heat index values up to 118 degrees possible. * WHERE...Jim Wells, Inland Kleberg, Inland Nueces and Inland San Patricio Counties. * WHEN...For the first Heat Advisory, until 7 PM CDT this evening. For the second Heat Advisory, from 1 PM to 7 PM CDT Wednesday. For the Excessive Heat Watch, from Thursday afternoon through Thursday evening. * IMPACTS...Extreme heat and humidity will significantly increase the potential for heat related illnesses, particularly for those working or participating in outdoor activities.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts and warnings for updates on this situation. Be prepared to drink plenty of fluids, stay in an air- conditioned room, stay out of the sun, and check up on relatives and neighbors. Young children and pets should never be left unattended in vehicles under any circumstances. This is especially true during warm or hot weather when car interiors can reach lethal temperatures in a matter of minutes.
